notes: Hoynes (2014 AER P&P) 'Living Arrangements, Doubling Up, and the Great Recession'. State-year panel from March CPS 1980-2013, examining how living arrangements respond to state unemployment rate fluctuations. Panel A (Table 1) regresses living arrangement measures on the state unemployment rate with state and year FE, weighted by population, SE clustered at state level. Panel B allows recession-period-specific coefficients. Two headline outcomes are household size and fraction living alone (young adults 18-30). We focus on the 18-30 young adult living-alone outcome as the main baseline claim since it is the paper's central finding, with household size as a second baseline group.

design_audit.notes: State-year panel with state and year FE, analytic weights from CPS population counts, SE clustered at state level. The raw data column is 'statefip'; the do-file renames it to 'stfips'. In pyfixest, use 'statefip' as the panel unit (or rename in preprocessing to match the do-file).

claim_object.outcome_concept: Fraction of young adults (18-30) living alone (not doubled up)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Effect of a 1-percentage-point increase in state unemployment rate on fraction living alone, conditional on state and year FE
claim_object.target_population: Young adults aged 18-30 across US states, 1980-2013

constraints.notes: The paper uses no additional controls beyond state and year FE. The only variation is in the treatment variable specification (pooled vs recession-period-specific) and outcome/sample definitions. No control pool to vary.

canonical.notes: Clustered at state level, matching the paper's baseline: vce(cluster stfips).

variants.notes: Coarser clustering at Census region level (few clusters stress test). NOTE: 'region' must be constructed from state FIPS codes (statefip) -- it does not exist in the data. Use Census region definitions (Northeast=1, Midwest=2, South=3, West=4).
Driscoll-Kraay SEs for cross-sectional dependence in state panels.

budgets.notes: No control pool to sample from. Variation comes from outcome definitions, sample restrictions, functional form, FE structure, weighting, and time periods. Full enumeration feasible.

sampling.notes: Full enumeration. No controls to sample.

design_audit.notes: State-year panel with state and year FE, analytic weights, SE clustered at state level.

claim_object.estimand_concept: Effect of a 1-percentage-point increase in state unemployment rate on average household size, conditional on state and year FE

constraints.notes: No additional controls beyond state and year FE.

canonical.notes: Clustered at state level, matching the paper's baseline.

budgets.notes: Secondary claim; fewer specs than G1. Full enumeration feasible.
